article.title: Identifying Subjective and Figurative Language in Online Dialogue

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the values associated with the "Nasty" label indicate in Figure 1?
choices: The level of agreement between annotators on the nastiness of the utterance.
The number of negative words used in the utterance.
The strength of nastiness expressed in the utterance, with highly negative values indicating strong nastiness.
The probability of the utterance being classified as nasty by an automated system.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the "Pattern-Based Classifier" in the bootstrapping method shown in Figure 2?
choices: To identify sarcastic and nasty cue words in the text.
To label posts as sarcastic or nasty based on the presence of identified cue words.
To refine the initial classification by identifying general syntactic patterns associated with sarcasm and nastiness.
To measure the performance of the Cue-Based Classifier.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE based on the results presented in Table 1?
choices: Using only the baseline patterns (BASELINE PATS) results in higher precision for both SARC and NASTY compared to using the new, fine-tuned patterns (NEW PATS).
The Cue-Based Classifier achieves higher precision than the Pattern-Based Classifier for both SARC and NASTY.
The new, fine-tuned patterns (NEW PATS) significantly improve the precision for SARC while slightly sacrificing recall.
The best performing model overall for NASTY combines both the Cue-Based and Pattern-Based Classifiers.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of the article and specifically the formula " 01 < FREQ and 02 < SARC," what do the variables FREQ and SARC represent?
choices: FREQ represents the length of the utterance and SARC represents the sentiment score.
FREQ represents the number of times a cue appears in the training data and SARC represents the percentage of times that cue is associated with sarcasm.
FREQ represents the frequency of sarcastic utterances in the dataset and SARC represents the average length of a sarcastic utterance.
FREQ represents the occurrence of specific grammatical structures and SARC refers to the presence of sentiment-bearing words.
